result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott D Huber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay costs of the action, including Court-appointed attorney fees upon Court's approval of attorney fee bill. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No contact with Sara Siefert except as directed by Dept. of Corrections.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott D Huber

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Scott D Huber in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson. Defendant Scott D Huber in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest plea to Count 2. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, accepts plea, and finds Defendant guilty of Count 2. Count 1 is dismissed but read in for sentencing.  State/Defense make joint sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.

Defendant Scott D Huber in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson.  Defendant Scott D Huber in custody.  Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Atty Erickson indicates defendant waived his revocation and paperwork from DOC hasn't been submitted to the court yet. Atty Erickson request another date for sentencing after revocation and plea/sentencing. Bond remains in effect.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 19, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Contract for Repayment of Court-appointed Attorney Fees
Court appoints Atty Grant Erickson to represent defendant. Defendant to pay $75.00 per month toward atty fees. First payment is due by 8/15/16.
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Scott D Huber in court with attorney Grant Alexander Erickson.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file.  Atty Erickson willing to accept a court appointment if court willing to appoint him to represent defendant. Atty Erickson was court appointed on a previous file. Court will send petition with defendant to fill out, will appoint Atty Erickson to represent defendant. Defense waives reading of the complaint, enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause for bindover. Court willing to appoint Atty Erickson on the revocation case also. Defense would like another status sooner than later. Bond remains in effect.  Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2016 at 08:00 am.
from defendants parents to the court.
To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Scott D Huber in court, in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant is getting an attorney through his father. Bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.
